Breadth-First.Explanation: Divergent exploration listing multiple candidate locations (Castle Hill, Windsor Castle, Horse Guards Parade, Buckingham Palace) and general guard features without a specific hypothesis to verify

Depth-First.Explanation: Comparing detailed architectural features across candidate sites to narrow down the hypothesis
Depth-First.KeyElement: Stone crenellations, narrow lancet windows, red gravel at Windsor Castle

Depth-First.Explanation: Refining the hypothesis to the correct granularity and naming convention based on the prompt
Depth-First.KeyElement: Specifying Lower Ward (Quadrangle) at Windsor Castle, Windsor, Berkshire

Depth-First.Explanation: In-depth verification of uniforms, surface materials, and wall structure to confirm the exact spot
Depth-First.KeyElement: British Foot Guards in red tunics on red gravel before medieval crenellated curtain-wall

Depth-First.Explanation: Final confirmation and succinct statement of the precise location
Depth-First.KeyElement: Lower Ward (Quadrangle), Windsor Castle, Windsor, Berkshire, England

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: After listing broad possibilities, the analysis focuses on specific architectural clues to verify and narrow down to Windsor Castle
